lead_paragraph: The Courier and Enquirer rebukes those who attempt to palliate the late Syracuse outrage, on the ground that the law is repugnant to public sentiment, and denies that an argument like this can extenuate any case of forcible resistance to law. It is addnitted that all our multitudinous laws are not equally binding, yet the frustration of any law by force is essentially treasonable.
